ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 222
ygData.msgSnippet: I wasn t sure if regular heals worked on our pets, but I know for a FACT that regulars work on Mage pets. As a Druid, I usta group with a Mage and I could just
ygData.messageBody:
I wasn't sure if regular heals worked on our pets, but I know for a FACT that
regulars work on Mage pets. As a Druid, I usta group with a Mage and I could
just sit back and keep his pet healed.

In a message dated 1/18/00 4:23:12 AM Pacific Standard Time,
EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com writes:

<< Message: 3
Date: Mon, 17 Jan 2000 18:45:09 -0500
From: "Dark" <jackal@...>
Subject: Re: Magician pet heal spells?

Heh well regular heal spells work on our pet. So it's quite fair. I don't
think heals work on magi pets anyway.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: Aazen1@... <Aazen1@...>
To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, January 17, 2000 4:02 PM
Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Magician pet heal spells?


>From: Aazen1@...
>
>If you haven't already, go take a look over at the EQCasters site. They
have

>mistaken, but I thought that we got pet heal spells because regular
peoples'
>heals would not work on OUR pets, but they would on Mages. I guess its
>true-Anyone besides Necromancer(lol), who whines long enough, gets what
they
>want. >>
